column5: Are you talking about me
ya I found 3 crappie through the ice this year.. and already have x that by 100

Good news sure travels fast. I went there this afternoon after fixing the marine railway and getting the boat out of storage. When I got there, there were already 5 other boats all in a small area. I didn't bother staying, I'll get out early tomorrow and get a nice feed of them.
Nice haul!   I know where that is lol .... Who wants to go?

Blue gills were hitting like crazy this morning, crappie were few and far between, I think the high wind and cold front might have slowed them down a bit. I did get a few for a feed though. Saw two other boats in there about the same results.
Nice haul and great size. I always do best over a black bottom very early, the waters warm more quickly there especially on a sunny day, look shallow and over black muck bottoms.
Jer, thanks for sending me that recipe, I will be trying it this week.

I took my son and a friends daughter out for some spring slab action this afternoon. Once we got on them, it was non stop action. These two had a blast. They wanted to do everything themselves today, so other than a couple tough hook removals, I let them have atter. There was quite the competition going on with these two!! We kept 30 12"ers, and released many more that size and bigger! Great action and a ton of fun for the kids.......we had a great day!!    Awesome average size!!    Great weather, great company, some monster slabs, and a HUGE fish fry at the end of the day.......does it get any better???  S.
Great stuff Shayne.. love the hold! Saw the pic earlier and thought they were brother/sister !
Wow.  Nice haul man.  Nice to see people enjoying the ice out Kawartha's.
I love seeing kids enjoying fishing that much. Makes me miss the times when my kids thought fishing was cool... Hehehe... Great work!
Well done on a successful outing. The kid's faces tell the whole story
You the slab king Shayne The kids smile says it all Jacques
Way to go Sinker! I'm absolutely drooling now! Looks like the kids had a blast and some good eatin to boot!
Nice haul there! Nice to see a t-shirt fishing day by Good Friday!
NICE
Sweet!
Nice Fish -Ben
looks great---we made it thru another winter
Nice haul, did you get over to the place we talked about? I'm thinking of trying there today.
Nice slabs!!

Nice pics of the kids and the "cooler o slabs". Sounds like an awesome day. Heading out the door at 9 for Scugog to try and find some slabs ourselves.  Thx for sharing your day Shayne. I never get tired of seeing Jacob smiling and holding up fish for a picture.
What a result!  great report there Sinker, nice haul of slabs!
nice going Shayne you guys did great  my first day fishing the Kawarthas was Kawartha 1 .....................................................................Terry 0
It's really nice to see an early crappie bite. We were on Buckhorn yesterday and did fairly well once we found the right spot.  The fruits of our labours:    Yummy...
That's really cool, always great to see such happy kids.

Atta boy Jer! Nice work!!  We found them to be pretty isolated too. If you weren't casting within a 15ft circle, you didn't get bit.  It took a while to find them, but once we did, it sure was fun!!! Couldn't catch one to save our life anywhere else, just this one little hole.  S.
awesome ! good to hear every one had fun ! I was out there the past two days and the bite has been pretty good. just gota find them!

nice catch !!!!! wait till all the kawartha ice fishers read this post---LOL they were hunting for them all season long and you go out with 2 kids and slam them... ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Hey, I'm a kawartha icefisherman too!! I couldn't find the little buggers through the ice though!!! They're a lot easier to find when you have different temps in the water!!  S.
Great report! Looking forward to the same thing now the ice is gone.
Ixnay on the otherbray and istersay, Ayneway. If you can dig what I'm saying Jim
